result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deandre L Johnson

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Allison Marie Ritter in court for Deandre L Johnson. Defendant Deandre L Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Christopher Schindhelm in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for an Arraignment. Defense counsel waived reading of the Information and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant. State has filed a joinder motion. Parties request a hearing. Case adjourned, Branch 38.
Motion hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD. Defense unavailable for hearing and request a new arraignment hearing. Parties notified of new date.

Defendant Deandre L Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Allison Marie Ritter in court for Deandre L Johnson.  Attorney Michael Christopher Schindhelm in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Borowski.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Wagner, Br. 38.
Arraignment scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing ( 20 pages) commencing 07-07-2022 by Kathleen S. Worden.

Defendant Deandre L Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Christopher Schindhelm in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Case calendared for Status of Counsel this date.  Attorney Ritter unavailable and requests adjournment.
Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Retainer received and filed.  bm

Defendant Deandre L Johnson in court with attorney Amanda R. Kremer.  Defendant Deandre L Johnson in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Defendant advises the Court he may retain private counsel.  Status conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Joinder Motion received and filed.  bm
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court to address on Arraignment date.  bm

Defendant Deandre L Johnson in court with Attorney Amanda R. Kremer.  Defendant Deandre L Johnson in custody.  Jennifer Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective B. Maciewjewski.  Court took judicial notice of 16CF1427 & 22CF1050.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 12.  Arraignment scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Deandre L Johnson in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Defendant Deandre L Johnson in custody.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deandre L Johnson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
